project.teaser: In Re-Value, 9 European waterfront cities (Ålesund, Bruges, Burgas, In Re-Value, 9 European waterfront cities (Ålesund, Bruges, Burgas, Rimini, Cascais, Constanta, Izmir, Písek, and Rijeka) will test, capture and share how to create value through urban quality, in a...
project.objective: In Re-Value, 9 European waterfront cities (Ålesund, Bruges, Burgas, In Re-Value, 9 European waterfront cities (Ålesund, Bruges, Burgas, Rimini, Cascais, Constanta, Izmir, Písek, and Rijeka) will test, capture and share how to create value through urban quality, in a holistic approach towards climate neutrality. They will cover 6 systemic challenges of urban planning and design, aligned with the Cities Mission: - Systemic changes in governance, regulatory structures, advocacy - Societal and spatial quality - Financial and circular value chains - Data-driven co-creation, digital twins - Energy and mobility - Nature-based solutions The model will be supported by 3 Innovation Cycles that run across the cities - Aligning climate neutrality and urban quality, using participatory story-building to identify co-benefits - Co-creating data-driven transition scenarios, empowering cities to use better data / data better - De-risking investments, through value-based financial and partnership models to enable the cities to document and capture different values in urban complexity, and to synthesise them into a holistic approach towards climate neutrality. Supported by this approach, the 9 Re-Value Cities will fine-tune, share and test a Portfolio of Urban Design and Planning Methods in the project’s Community of Practice. 4 Leading Cities (Ålesund, Bruges, Burgas, and Rimini) will demonstrate full-scale how integrated urban planning and design can be optimally deployed to achieve climate neutrality and significantly reduce GHG emissions by 2030. 5 Replication Cities (Cascais, Constanta, Izmir, Písek, and Rijeka) will learn, replicate and develop their own visions, scenarios and investment plans to accelerate their journeys to climate neutrality. While geographically and culturally diverse, the 9 cities share a curiosity and ambition to experiment, learn from each other, and share the Re-Value results and outcomes together with other cities in the Cities Mission communities.
project.title: Re-Valuing Urban Quality & Climate Neutrality in European Waterfront Cities
project.keywords: Social innovation, culture, New European Bauhaus, co-creation process, story-building, Territorial Transformation Plans

result.title: Re-Value Innovation Cycles experience-based report 2
result.description: This report summarises the learnings and results from the second set of Innovation Cycles on Story-Building, Scenario-Building and Investment and Partnership Models. (Linked to T1.2, T1.3, and T1.4)

result.title: Re-Value Impact dialogues with NetZeroCities 1
result.description: This report summarises the exchange of M&E results and learnings with the NetZeroCities platform. (Linked to T7.3)

result.title: Re-Value Innovation Camps Report 1
result.description: This report summarises experiences and learnings from the Innovation Camps to specifically target youth and parents to build awareness and skills to shape local planning and design and more broadly climate neutrality processes. (Linked to T8.2)

result.title: Re-Value local CD Plans by Leading and Replication Cities 1
result.description: This is a collection of the LCs' and RCs' CDE plans, mirroring the overall CDE plan with and for local context. (Linked to T8.1)

result.title: Re-Value Impact Model (initial version)
result.description: The initial version of the Re-Value impact model. It will capture the operationalisation of the triangle of sustainability, inclusion and aesthetics towards a climate-neutral future and will incorporate the results from the Innovation Cycles (T1.2-1.4) and the monitoring of impact (T7.2), and be qualified with the 9 cities. (Linked to T1.1)

result.title: Energia solar no ambiente urbano: caso de estudo, desafios, abordagens e investigação (Solar energy in the urban environment: case studies, challenges, approaches and research)

details.authors: Viana S., Simões T., Aelenei L., Justino P.

result.title: Detailed Roadmap for the Waterfront Pilot in Rimini
result.description: The roadmap will be aligned with the Re-Value Impact Model (WP1) and the EU Cities Mission and will be based on feasibility studies with co-benefits and potential negative externalities of climate neutrality and urban quality, viable investment and partnership models, a strong and widely supported story, and a well-established support base for co-creation with local citizens and professional stakeholders. (Linked to T5.2)

result.title: Re-Value Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan 2
result.description: This is the overall Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation Plan for communication, campaign, dissemination, policy engagement and briefs, and exploitation of project results. This version updates the plan where needed and reports on results. (Linked to T8.1)

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Re-Value (Re-Valuing Urban Quality & Climate Neutrality in European Waterfront Cities)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: Re-Value is working with 9 European waterfront cities (Ålesund, Bruges, Burgas,Rimini, Cascais, Constanta, Izmir, Písek, and Rijeka) to make their urban transition irresistible for citizens and professional stakeholders. The project is inspired by the New European Bauhaus'...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Detailed Roadmap for the Waterfront Pilot in Burgas
result.description: The roadmap will be aligned with the Re-Value Impact Model (WP1) and the EU Cities Mission and will be based on feasibility studies with co-benefits and potential negative externalities of climate neutrality and urban quality, viable investment and partnership models, a strong and widely supported story, and a well-established support base for co-creation with local citizens and professional stakeholders. (Linked to T4.2)

result.title: Inclusiveness and Diversity Management Plan 1
result.description: This initial report will develop and evolve the plan for inclusiveness and diversity management across the project as defined in Sec.1.2.4. (Linked to T9.3)

result.title: Re-Value M&E Model (first intermediate version)
result.description: First intermediate version of the co-created M&E model based on WP1, established best practices, and requirements, practices, and methodologies of NZC and Mission Platform. Updated according to feedback from T7.2. (Linked to T7.1, updated version)

result.title: Re-Value Capacity Building and Exchange Programme 2
result.description: This report summarises the experiences with the co-created programme for learning and exchange between the cities, connected with the Mission Platform of the Cities Mission. The Re-Value Programme will be evaluated using a strategic learning approach, and iterated and updated on a yearly basis to ensure that the modules and elements are meeting the programme’s objectives and participants’ needs, and aligned with RC/LC capacity and priorities. (Linked to T6.1)

result.title: Spatio-Temporal Challenges in Understanding your (Smart) City – Keynote

details.journalTitle: 14th Temporal Web Analytics Workshop (TempWeb 2024) @ The Web Conference 2024 (WWW2024)

result.title: Open Science and Data Management Plan 1
result.description: This report is the initial version that develops the Data Management Plan (DMP), and details the Open Science approach and Research Data Management, including open access to research data, with all beneficiaries and WPs. (Linked to T9.2)

result.title: Re-Value Innovation Cycles experience-based report 1
result.description: This report summarises the learnings and results from the first set of Innovation Cycles on Story-Building, Scenario-Building and Investment and Partnership Models. (Linked to T1.2, T1.3, and T1.4)

result.title: Re-Value Capacity Building and Exchange Programme 1
result.description: This report summarises the experiences with the co-created programme for learning and exchange between the cities, connected with the Mission Platform of the Cities Mission. The Re-Value Programme will be evaluated using a strategic learning approach, and iterated and updated on a yearly basis to ensure that the modules and elements are meeting the programme’s objectives and participants’ needs, and aligned with RC/LC capacity and priorities. (Linked to T6.1)

result.title: Re-Value Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan 1
result.description: This is the overall Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation Plan for communication, campaign, dissemination, policy engagement and briefs, and exploitation of project results.The initial version jointly defines all aspects ready for use in the project. It also sets up the basic communication measures such as Visual Identity, Website and Social Media.It includes Campaign Strategy & Toolkit, Key Messages, and target/involvement communities/groups, mobilisation measures, outreach monitoring, and support in event participation. (Linked to T8.1)

result.title: Re-Value M&E Report 1
result.description: This report summarises main findings and KPIs monitoring and evaluating the project results. It collects data in such a manner that is comparable and aligned with the Cities Mission and Net Zero Cities Platform. The first report includes baselines for the project's KPIs. (Linked to T7.2)

result.title: Detailed Roadmap for the Waterfront Pilot in Ålesund
result.description: The roadmap will be aligned with the Re-Value Impact Model (WP1) and the EU Cities Mission and will be based on feasibility studies with co-benefits and potential negative externalities of climate neutrality and urban quality, viable investment and partnership models, a strong and widely supported story, and a well-established support base for co-creation with local citizens and professional stakeholders. (Linked to T2.2)

result.title: Re-Value Impact Model (intermediate version)
result.description: The intermediate version of the Re-Value impact model. It will capture the operationalisation of the triangle of sustainability, inclusion and aesthetics towards a climate-neutral future and will incorporate the results from the Innovation Cycles (T1.2-1.4) and the monitoring of impact (T7.2), and be qualified with the 9 cities. (Linked to T1.1, updated version)

result.title: Re-Value M&E Model (initial version)
result.description: Initial version of the co-created M&E model based on WP1, containing established best practices, requirements, practices, and methodologies of NZC and Mission Platform. The first version includes an initial summary of the activities that will be piloted, implemented or demonstrated and the expected outputs, the schedule of each activity - start and end date, duration and the monitoring moments; and the method and indicators planned to be used to monitor the progress and measure the success of each activity. (Linked to T7.1)

result.title: Inclusiveness and Diversity Management Plan 2
result.description: This report will develop and evolve the plan for inclusiveness and diversity management across the project as defined in Sec.1.2.4. (Linked to T9.3, updated version)

result.title: Detailed Roadmap for the Waterfront Pilot in Bruges
result.description: The roadmap will be aligned with the Re-Value Impact Model (WP1) and the EU Cities Mission and will be based on feasibility studies with co-benefits and potential negative externalities of climate neutrality and urban quality, viable investment and partnership models, a strong and widely supported story, and a well-established support base for co-creation with local citizens and professional stakeholders. (Linked to T3.2)

result.title: Re-Value Urban Design and Planning Approaches (initial version)
result.description: Initial version of the Portfolio of Value-Based Urban Planning and Design Approaches summarising tools, partnership and investment models, based on best and aspiring practices in the 9 waterfront cities, with evidence-based guidelines and practical recommendations for their effective and optimal use. (Linked to T6.1)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
